column4: I want to store all my mail in a local imap server, and have it fetched from my ISP's pop3 servers and preferably spam filtered as well... I'm a bit overwhelmed by the choice of software available.  Can someone recommend a combination for me?

I set up qmail in the past (long time ago though) with fetchmail. I see quite a few simple imap servers operate with maildir, which I think means I have to use qmail or one of the mailservers which uses maildir.  Is that right?
I use courier-imap and Postfix for delivery in maildirs
that sounds like a sendible combination
Qmail is a patch nightmare and I wouldn't recommand it except for specific unknown needs)
do you need to use fetchmail as well?
or do you get your mail sent in by smtp?
not quite, I have a regular MX with domains
the last time I looked about fetchmail there are several ways to interface it with Postifix, Either by SMTP forwarder or directly feeding the delivery agent
Ah ok.  Makes sense.  My ISP can support that even without a domain, but I'm not convinced enough about my broadband + machine availability!  Fetchmail should work fine though, right?
I ran my own MX behind a DSL line with static IP during 2 yers until 6months ago I could rent a dedicated server for 24Euro/month (30USD)

This is a bit more detail stuff, and maybe i need to figure this out later, but I use two accounts, a work one and a personal one.  Currently I fetch both and use rules in my mail program to route them to different folders.  Can I do that routing in the maildir automatically with postfix?
the default Postfix provided delivery agent does not support user customized delivery. You can use procmail or maildrop for that
ldap look the most versatile way. It is the toughest as well though
If you can enjoy webmails, contacts go well in plain text or SQL databases. If you want MUA addressbook connectivity, it's Ldap
thanks for the advice!  Much appreciated
